intro: Guizotia zavattarii, commonly known as the Zavattari's guizotia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Guizotia zavattarii is often found in rocky soils and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche.
